description: Identify patients correctly.

subStandards.description: Use at least two patient identifiers when providing care, treatment, and services.
Label containers used for blood and other specimens in the presence of the patient.

description: Improve effective communication.
The organization has a process for patient admission.
Establish a quality management system.
Medication management processes are in place.
The hospital has an effective governing body.
The organization is managed by qualified leaders.
Patient clinical records are complete and accurate.
The hospital displays information to patients and families on services provided.

subStandards.description: The hospital uses a variety of methods to display information, such as posters, brochures, media, MOH portals, or websites, with methods of how to access its services.
All hospital staff are oriented to these services, mainly the staff in reception, outpatient department, and in-patient departments.
The hospital uses appropriate language and format to provide information about its services to patients, families, and community.

description: The hospital implements a mechanism to ensure the provision of a unified standard of care to patients.

subStandards.description: Patient’s care is provided according to the policies, laws and regulations.

Department leaders ensure that all patients receive the same standards of care throughout the hospital departments, all the time (during the morning, afternoon, or night, working hours, or off-hours, regardless of their race, gender, or religion and whether they can pay or not.
Every patient has an individualized care plan based on their initial assessment and reassessment.
Each patient attending in-patient or outpatient services receives awareness about their rights and responsibilities.
The hospital designs and carries out processes to provide continuity of patient care services in the hospital and coordination among health care providers.
The hospital has qualified professionals responsible for the patient’s care during all phases of in-patient care.

description: The hospital has a standardized method for registration and admission of patients within its scope of services that meet patients' health needs.

subStandards.description: The hospital has a clear policy and procedures describing the process used for admission in various departments, including: Roles and responsibilities, Elective vs. Emergency admissions, Day care, Outpatient registration, Managing bed unavailability, and Admission pathways.
All staff are oriented about the standardized process of admission of patients to various hospital settings.
Each patient has a unique registration identification number through the process of admission.
Patients are accepted only if the hospital can provide the services.
Hospital department leaders conduct monitoring audits to assess staff compliance to policies and procedures.
The staff are oriented to the admission policy and procedure to ensure a consistent admission process.
Each department has an admission criterion designed for their scope of service.
There is a regular audit conducted to monitor compliance of the admission process by healthcare staff to ensure standardized practice.

description: The hospital has a clear mechanism for patient transfer.

subStandards.description: The hospital has a documented transfer policy for patients' intra and inter-hospital transfers.
Hospital staff are oriented about the transfer process.
Hospital leaders and staff are responsible for providing detailed information on patient assessments, reason for transfer, clinical findings, and medication use.
A unified checklist is recommended to structure the transfer process and mitigate risks.
The receiving unit staff is responsible for assessing the patient’s condition on arrival to ensure safety and appropriate service transfer.
The hospital monitors staff compliance with the transfer policy to ensure standardized practice.

description: The hospital has a clear process for assessment of patients throughout the care process.

subStandards.description: Hospital has clear policies for patient physical assessment, re-assessment, time frames, and content for various care settings (Inpatient, Outpatient, Critical Care, Emergency).
The policy defines the scope and content of assessment by each discipline (physicians, nurses, social services, dietitians, etc.).
The hospital ensures training for relevant staff on proper assessment policies and procedures.
Assessment includes discharge planning, required diagnostic testing, and care level priorities.
Evidence ensures all patients are reassessed at appropriate intervals to determine treatment response and plan further care.
The hospital uses standardized assessment tools (Pain score, Fall risk, Nutritional assessment, Physical assessments, Skin assessment).
Patients are reassessed to confirm the effectiveness of care plans and response to treatment.
Documentation of the patient’s care plan is maintained in electronic medical records.
Department heads conduct regular monitoring to ensure staff compliance with policies and procedures.

description: The hospital has laboratory services that are applicable to national laws and regulations, to meet patient needs.

subStandards.description: The hospital has laboratory services that are under national standards, laws, and regulations.

The laboratory services unit has a clear scope of services to meet the needs related to the hospital mission and patient populations, emergency needs, covering twenty-four hours a day, seven days a week.
Essential, simple laboratory services are available twenty-four hours a day, seven days a week. This includes hematology services, biochemistry, and blood bank).
When special diagnostic tests are not available, there is clear process for referral and follow up of diagnostic tests.

description: The radiology department is well staffed with qualified, trained, experienced staff.

subStandards.description: The director/ head of radiology department is qualified, trained, skilled and experienced radiologist.
The radiology department staff have proper qualifications, training, and experience.
Hospital has twenty-four-hour radiology service coverage
The radiology department has a mechanism on developing human resources.
The radiology department have records of staff trained in Basic Life Support (BLS).

description: The organization upholds and protects patient rights and responsibilities.

subStandards.description: Patients are informed of their rights and responsibilities upon admission in a language and manner they understand.
The organization has a clear process for handling patient complaints and grievances.

description: The organization's leaders create a culture of quality and patient safety.
The organization provides a safe and functional environment for patients, staff, and visitors.

subStandards.description: A documented fire safety plan is in place and regularly tested.
Medical equipment is managed, maintained, and inspected regularly.

description: The organization has a written fire prevention plan.
Each medical record contains a unique identifier.
